name: Binarymessenger
tagline: Android messenger for basic encrypted messaging
body:
# Binary Messenger Read here
An android app that lets users to chat with minimal password security. ##Protocol The project utilizes XMPP (protocol) and Google AppEngine (backend). CCS (Cloud connection service) over GCM (Google Cloud Messaging) is used to serve as a server and software layer. ##Software The project has a built in backend using Google Endpoints Android Studio plugin. ##Usage A user can simply sign in using Google, set a password, add contacts using Email and chat easily. ##Access The app pings up a notification whenever a new message arrives. ##Proposed changes 1. Adding a set of better key encrypted protocols from which a user can choose one.
2. Modfying view layer.
3. Setting up custom XMPP server.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
